SYNIP0008_syn_1:
Indication: Extrinsic tracheal compression (Lymphoma).
Procedure: Rigid Bronch + Silicone Stent.
Findings: 65% mid-distal tracheal narrowing.
Action: Dilated to 13mm. Placed 13x50mm silicone stent.
Result: Lumen patent.
Plan: Oncology floor.
SYNIP0008_syn_2:
INDICATION: Critical airway compromise due to mediastinal lymphoma compressing the trachea.
PROCEDURE: Rigid bronchoscopy was performed under general anesthesia. Significant extrinsic compression of the mid-to-distal trachea was noted. The airway was gently dilated to accept a prosthesis. A 13 x 50 mm silicone tracheal stent was deployed, spanning the length of the compression. Post-deployment visualization confirmed restoration of the airway lumen and relief of the obstruction.
DISPOSITION: Admitted to oncology service.
SYNIP0008_syn_3:
Code: 31631 (Tracheal Stent).
Dx: Lymphoma with tracheal compression.
Device: 13x50mm Silicone Stent.
Note: Stent used to maintain patency against extrinsic compression. Dilation bundled.
SYNIP0008_syn_4:
Procedure: Tracheal Stent
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. GA/Rigid scope.
2. Saw compression from lymphoma.
3. Dilated.
4. Placed 13x50 silicone stent.
5. Airway looks much better.
Extubated to floor.
SYNIP0008_syn_5: Lila Shah has lymphoma pushing on her windpipe. We used the rigid scope to open it up. Put in a long silicone stent 13 by 50 to hold the airway open against the pressure. It looks good now breathing is better. No bleeding. Back to the floor.
SYNIP0008_syn_6: INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT Patient: Lila Shah 49/F Date: [REDACTED] Indication: Extrinsic tracheal compression from mediastinal lymphoma with progressive stridor. Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical dilation and silicone tracheal stent placement. Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy; anesthesia team present. Findings: Long-segment mid to distal tracheal narrowing (~65% reduction in lumen) from external compression; mucosa intact. Intervention: Gentle mechanical dilatation with the rigid barrel and serial balloon inflations up to 13 mm restored tracheal caliber. A 13 x 50 mm silicone tracheal stent was deployed spanning the compressed segment. Post-placement, tracheal lumen was widely patent with minimal residual narrowing and improved airflow. Complications: None immediate. Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted to oncology floor for ongoing lymphoma management.
SYNIP0008_syn_7:
[Indication]
Tracheal compression, Lymphoma.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Extrinsic compression dilated. 13x50mm silicone stent placed. Airway secured.
[Plan]
Oncology admission.
SYNIP0008_syn_8: [REDACTED] pressing on her trachea from the outside, making it narrow. We went in and placed a silicone stent—kind of like a stiff tube—inside the trachea to hold it open against that pressure. It worked well, and the airway is nice and wide now.
SYNIP0008_syn_9:
Indication: Extrinsic tracheal compression from mediastinal lymphoma.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical expansion and silicone tracheal stent insertion.
Intervention: Gentle mechanical expansion was performed. A 13 x 50 mm silicone tracheal stent was installed spanning the compressed segment. Post-placement, tracheal lumen was widely open.
